channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New All-Time Highs for Small Caps?
item.description: Hey, Ross here! The small-cap Russell 2000 has been lagging behind other major indexes, still sitting below its 2021 highs. But as the chart shows, it’s now on the verge of a breakout. If it clears those highs, the potential upside for small-cap traders like us could be massive. Here’s the thing, though—you don’t need to wait for the breakout to act. I explain why in today’s Insight. The post New All-Time Highs for Small Caps? appeared first on Stock Surge Daily .

item.title: What the Market has in Store for December
item.description: Hey, Ross here! The Equal-Weight S&P 500 Index (RSP) just hit a new high, even as the traditional S&P 500 lags behind its mid-November levels. This flip is rare in this bull market, where larger-cap names typically lead the way. But something is shifting beneath the surface, and it could have major implications for how you trade. I break it all down in today’s Insight. The post What the Market has in Store for December appeared first on Stock Surge Daily .

I break it all down in today’s Insight. The post What the Market has in Store for December appeared first on Stock Surge Daily .

item.title: This Will Keep Driving the Market Up
item.description: Hey, Ross here! The small-cap Russell 2000 is showing classic constructive price action. A few weeks ago, I highlighted the ascending triangle pattern it had formed. Since then, the index broke out, pulled back, and is now bouncing back—right on the previous resistance line, which has turned into support. This kind of setup signals opportunity. When smart traders spot constructive price action like this, they don’t hesitate. I break it all down in today’s Insight of the Day. Don’t miss it. The post This Will Keep Driving the Market Up appeared first on Stock Surge Daily .

item.title: Late November Market Rally Incoming?
item.description: Hey, Ross here! This chart tracks the S&P 500’s performance in November since 1950, and guess what? Pullbacks mid-month are completely normal. Historically, the market tends to resume its rally before the month ends. Despite the election noise, November 2024 is playing out in a way that’s surprisingly consistent with past trends. I break it all down—and explain why staying the course could pay off—in today’s insight. The post Late November Market Rally Incoming? appeared first on Stock Surge Daily .
